featured.text: As a result, the astronauts have swollen, puffy faces, very much resembling that of the round-headed Charlie Brown in the famous comic strip.
As the climate became drier and colder, they retreated to a narrow strip along the Pacific coast of Northern California.
23 the process of questioning, all the signals are recorded on a single strip of moving paper.

The mayor said new buildings would be illuminated, notably along the banks of the Seine, which would become a luminous strip, while Notre Dame Cathedral would be lit from the inside to show off its stained glass windows.

other.text: Each cookie 37 a strip of paper inside with an inspirational Bible quotation on it.
They can quickly strip fruit trees of their fruit.

definition.zh_def: 剝去、脫去或去除某物的外層或覆蓋物。
definition.en_def: To remove the outer layer or covering of something.
definition.example: She decided to strip the old paint off the furniture.
